title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: Lochnagar is a black lake of small dimensions, which sleeps, as it were, at the foot of a wide corrie or cleft in the summit of the mountain, consisting of a very lofty range of precipitous rocks.

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: A small lake at the base of a steep crag not far from Lochnagar, may be mistaken for it ; it is necessary, therefore, to bear in mind that Lochnagar  is not seen until the very summit is reached.

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: A small lake at the base of a steep crag not far from Lochnagar, may be mistaken for it ; it is necessary, therefore, to bear in mind that Lochnagar  is not seen until the very summit is reached.

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: But if these two last (to Lochnagar and Ben-muich-dhui) are taken, they will include all the others except Balmoral.

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: The more distant are to Lochnagar (12 miles), to Ben-muich-dhui and Loch A' an (20 miles).

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: A visit to Lochnagar  and Bcn-muich-dhui will afford the tourist a very good conception of this description of scenery, and the Castleton of Braemar is the best place from which to start on both these expeditions.

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: It is situated in the centre of a region of deer forests, comprehending  those of ilar (Earl of Fife), which stretches up Ben-muich- dhui; Balloch-bowie (Farquharson of Invercauld), which extends from Falls of the Garrawalt away by Lochnagar and Clova.

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: The adventurous traveller should not be content with Loch jMuick, but ought to ascend a stream at its upper extremity, by Avbich, after passing some miles of wildly broken ground, where cataracts start as it were every now and then at his feet, he will be led to the Dhu Loch (13 miles), a smaller lake than that of Muick, but grander in its scenery — its banks, except where the stream issues, being a circumvallation of huge black precipices, on the same scale with those of Lochnagar.

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: The loch is a considerable sheet of water, but somewhat sombre in its scenery, except in certain spots, where, over its rounded banks, the precipices of Lochnagar may be seen frowning grim and close.

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: Lord Byron spent some of the early part of his life near Lochnagar, and the recollection of that most " sublime and picturesque amongst our Caledonian Alps," as he styles it, gave birth to these beautiful stanzas, the perusal of which while here may gratify the reader ; —

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: Lochnagar, worthy of admiration on its own account, for ages before the bard existed, is another object of his Highland muse.

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: Highest of all, a long gracefully waving outline, bending on either side from a sharp peak, characterizes the mountain monarch of the district, Lochnagar.

title: A Voyage round Great Britain; with short views of Aberdeen, Balmoral, ... Fécamp, Havre and Paris
author: Hargreaves, Thomas
snippet: The estate comprises from 10,000 to12,000 acres, and the purchase price was 31,500/.,and extends from the Dee southwards to the summitof Lochnagar, where it joins the Birkhall and Abergeldie properties.
